oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Educational facilities
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: View of the front and side entrances to Shady Valley School in Johnson County. A group of five unidentified individuals is shown sitting on the steps of the side entrance.

The school was constructed in the late 1930s by the Works Progress Administration, consolidating several schools in Shady Valley, Johnson County. The WPA was the New Deal's largest agency and was created to carry out public works, including construction of roads, buildings and parks.
